analysisEngineMetaData.name: JCoRe Lingscope Negation AE
analysisEngineMetaData.description: This component runs the jcore-lingscope-ae in negation mode. Please see https://sourceforge.net/p/lingscope/wiki/detailed_instructions/ for information about Lingscope and the models available. To recognize negation cues, the 'negation_models/baseline_cue_all_both.model' is used. We use the baseline model because it is based on a dictionary which provides a wider coverage than the respective CRF-based cue detection algorithm which is trained on the BioScope corpus. The scope model used is 'negation_models/crf_scope_words_crf_all_both.model'.

configurationParameter.name: CueModel
configurationParameter.description: The model that is used to recognize the negation or hedge cue words in text. There are different models for negation and hedge detection in Lingscope, indicated by the directory names 'negation_models' and 'hedge_models' in the respective downloads from the Lingscope SourceForge page. The cue detection models are always those where the string 'cue' follows the 'baseline' or 'crf' string in the filename. Thus, all 'baseline_cue_*' and 'crf_cue_*' files are cue identification models. The 'crf_scope_cue_*' models, in contrast, are scope detection models that replace the cue words by the string CUE.

configurationParameter.name: ScopeModel
configurationParameter.description: The model that is used to detect the scope of a previously found negation or hedge cue word. There are different models for negation and hedge detection in Lingscope, indicated by the directory names 'negation_models' and 'hedge_models' in the respective downloads from the Lingscope SourceForge page. The cue detection models are always those where the string 'cue' follows the 'baseline' or 'crf' string in the filename. Thus, all 'baseline_cue_*' and 'crf_cue_*' files are cue identification models. The 'crf_scope_cue_*' models, in contrast, are scope detection models that replace the cue words by the string CUE.

configurationParameter.name: LikelihoodDict
configurationParameter.description: String parameter indicating path to likelihood dictionary (One entry per line; Entries consist of tab-separated lemmatized likelihood indicators and assigned likelihood category). The dictionary passed here is only used to assign likelihood scores (low, medium, high) to negation and hedge cues. It is not used to detect the cues in the first place.

configurationParameter.name: IsNegationAnnotator
configurationParameter.description: If set to true, the recognized cue words will all be assigned the 'negation' likelihood, even if the model used is a hedge model.
